questions.question: Which theorist wrote 'The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction'?

correctTheory.title: The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction
correctTheory.author: Walter Benjamin
correctTheory.key_concepts: Aura, authenticity, mechanical reproduction, mass culture
correctTheory.summary: Benjamin explores how mechanical reproduction of art changes its perception and cultural impact, introducing concepts like the loss of aura in reproduced works.
correctTheory.significance: Foundational text in modern art theory and cultural studies
correctTheory.related_concepts: Mass media, authenticity, cultural democratization

questions.question: Who coined the term 'Institutional Critique' in their artistic practice?

correctTheory.title: Institutional Critique
correctTheory.author: Hans Haacke
correctTheory.key_concepts: Art institution analysis, systemic critique, institutional power structures
correctTheory.summary: Artistic practice that examines and critiques the institutions of art, including museums, galleries, and the market system
correctTheory.significance: Established critical framework for analyzing art world power structures
correctTheory.related_concepts: Site-specificity, contextual art, political art

questions.question: Which philosopher wrote 'The Origin of the Work of Art'?

correctTheory.title: The Origin of the Work of Art
correctTheory.author: Martin Heidegger
correctTheory.key_concepts: Truth in art, being, earth and world, thing-concept
correctTheory.summary: Philosophical exploration of art's essence and its role in revealing truth
correctTheory.significance: Major influence on modern art theory and aesthetics
correctTheory.related_concepts: Phenomenology, truth in art, aesthetic theory

questions.question: Which critic introduced the concept of 'Greenbergian Modernism'?

correctTheory.author: Clement Greenberg
correctTheory.key_concepts: Medium specificity, flatness, optical experience
correctTheory.summary: Theory emphasizing the importance of medium-specific qualities in modern art
correctTheory.significance: Defined modernist art criticism for decades
correctTheory.related_concepts: Formalism, abstract expressionism, art criticism
